meanings.definition: To remove the fuse from (a bomb, explosive device, etc.)
meanings.sent1: He carefully defuzed the bomb to prevent an explosion.
meanings.sent2: The bomb squad had to defuze the explosive device quickly.
meanings.sent3: After defuzing the bomb, they all breathed a sigh of relief.
meanings.sent4: She defuzed the situation by calmly diffusing the tension.
meanings.sent5: The expert defuzed the bomb with steady hands and a focused mind.

meanings.definition: To render (a bomb, explosive device, etc.) harmless by removing the fuse.
meanings.sent1: The technician had to defuze the bomb to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to defuze any explosive device before handling it.
meanings.sent3: The spy defuzed the bomb in a daring and risky move.
meanings.sent4: By defuzing the bomb, they neutralized the threat completely.
meanings.sent5: The soldier defuzed the explosive with precision and expertise.
